Task:
  The response chooses one or more options from a set of alternatives.
constraints: Completeness ("full"): The response provides a thorough answer for normal use, covering all major aspects without needing every micro-detail.
Method ("models"): The response enhances the task by explicitly identifying and naming relevant mental models, explaining why they apply (or fail), and comparing or combining them.
Channel ("slack"): The response formats the answer for Slack using appropriate Markdown, mentions, and code blocks while avoiding channel-irrelevant decoration.
Directional ("rog"): The response modifies the task to examine the structure of the subject (how it is organized), then reflects on why that structure exists and what it reveals.
